Designed cross-project API: GET /api/tasks reads all work-items files, resolves slugs to project names
Designed cross-project save: edits route back to per-project PUT endpoint (existing pattern, no new write path)

decisions: Extend work items rather than create parallel system — avoids two tracking systems, one data source (data/work-items/) serves both per-project and cross-project views

tasks.title: Define technical approach for task tracker
subtasks: Read Thomas's requirements doc (6 user stories, schema extension, API design, AG Grid config)
Read existing work item tech approach to understand the system being extended
Read existing Zod schema (workItem.ts), store functions (workItems.ts), and route handlers (projects.ts)
Read projects.js work items section (~650 lines) — badge renderers, grid config, save logic, lazy AG Grid loading
Analyzed project store (projects.ts) — listProjects, getProject, slug generation, merge-on-read pipeline pattern
Read all HTML pages to understand nav structure (7 links) and hub card grid (7 cards) on index.html
Decided slug-to-name resolution happens server-side — one API call returns everything, client stays simple
Designed composite row ID strategy (slug::id) to prevent AG Grid deduplication across projects with same item IDs
Designed per-project debounced save — independent timers so editing tasks from different projects don't interfere
Decided js/tasks.js gets its own file — lifecycle is too different from projects.js to share code, badge renderer duplication is ~15 lines
Decided new server/src/routes/tasks.ts route file — follows one-file-per-resource convention (projects.ts, meetings.ts, etc.)
Wrote full API contract with response shapes for Alice + Jonah alignment
Classified all files: 3 new, 11 extended, 0 restructured
decisions: Slug-to-project-name resolution server-side in GET /api/tasks — reads all projects, builds slug map, joins with work-items. Client gets flat array with project info attached.
New route file server/src/routes/tasks.ts — /api/tasks is a top-level resource, not nested under /projects. Follows existing one-file-per-resource convention.

js/tasks.js is its own file — per-project code in projects.js is coupled to detail view lifecycle (lazy-load, destroy on collapse). Tasks page has fundamentally different needs (eager load, filters, modal, cross-project save).
Composite getRowId: slug::id — prevents AG Grid deduplication when different projects have items with the same ID (e.g., both have US-1).
Per-project debounced save timers — editing a Roadmap Tool task shouldn't delay saving a Task Tracker task. Independent 500ms timers keyed by project UUID.
Added project.id to GET /api/tasks response — Thomas's spec showed slug+name, added UUID so client can construct PUT URLs without a separate lookup.
WorkItemSchema change classified as Modify (not Extend) — we're changing the shape of the type, but it's backward-compatible with defaults. Low risk.

Visual verification via Playwright: page loads with 36 tasks from Roadmap Tool project, grid renders all columns with data, badges display, owner avatars present, stats show '36 tasks across 1 project'

AG Grid theming console warning (error #239) is a pre-existing issue from the CDN CSS approach used on spreadsheets.html too — not introduced by this implementation, not a design concern

tasks.title: Responsive layout review of task tracker page
subtasks: Read design spec (docs/task-tracker-design-spec.md) section 11 responsive behavior, section 13 accessibility/touch targets
Read css/tasks.css — verified mobile media query at max-width:639px with filter bar stacking, title centering, button centering, search full-width
Read css/shared.css — verified nav flex-wrap handles 8 links, container padding scales 20px mobile → 32px tablet+
Read css/styles.css — verified hub__grid breakpoints: 1fr mobile → repeat(2,1fr) at 640px → repeat(4,1fr) at 1024px
Read css/spreadsheet.css — confirmed .thq-spreadsheet compact density rule at max-width:767px does NOT apply to tasks grid (no thq-spreadsheet class)
Tested at 1440x900 (desktop) via Playwright — all 7 columns visible, filter bar horizontal, nav 8 links on one row, hub 4x2 grid
Tested at 1024x768 (tablet landscape) — all columns visible, filter bar horizontal, no overflow
Tested at 768x1024 (tablet portrait) — columns tight but visible, filter bar wraps naturally
Tested at 375x812 (mobile) — filter bar stacks vertically, title centered, button centered, nav wraps to 2 rows, grid shows 3 of 7 columns
Tested at 320x568 (smallest mobile) — layout holds, title column truncated heavily, nav wraps cleanly
Tested New Task modal at 375px — nearly full-width with overlay padding, fields stacked, Cancel/Create buttons visible
Tested hub page (index.html) at 1440px — 4x2 grid with 8 cards including Tasks card, at 375px — single column stack
Verified no horizontal overflow on body at any viewport (no unwanted horizontal scrollbar)
Checked filter select heights against 44px touch target minimum — 32px is below threshold on mobile
Checked grid column clipping at mobile — 4 of 7 columns hidden with no scroll affordance
decisions: PASS with 3 P2 notes — no P1 issues, nothing blocks ship
P2-1: Filter select touch targets are 32px on mobile (below 44px minimum). appearance:none prevents native OS touch target enlargement. Recommend adding min-height:44px at mobile breakpoint.

P2-2: No horizontal scroll affordance for grid on mobile — 4 of 7 columns clipped at 375px with no visual hint that scrolling reveals more data. Spreadsheet page has scroll-hint gradient; tasks grid does not.
P2-3: '+New Task' button height is ~36px (padding 8+8 + line-height 20), slightly below 44px touch minimum. Centered and prominent so easy to tap, but technically non-compliant.

Spec deviation (not an issue): Design spec called for compact grid density (32px rows) on mobile. Implementation keeps 44px rows. I recommend keeping 44px — 32px rows would violate touch target minimum and cause misclicks on the editable Status/Priority cells.

tasks.title: Interaction quality review of task tracker page
subtasks: Read design spec section 12 (Animation & Transitions) and section 6 (Interaction States) for all animation/transition specifications

Read css/tasks.css — verified filter bar transitions (border-color 150ms, search width 200ms), toast entrance animation (200ms ease-out slide+fade), loading pulse (1.5s thq-pulse), clear button hover (color 150ms), project link hover (color 150ms), New Task button hover (background-color 150ms)
Read css/spreadsheet.css — verified row hover transition (120ms ease), header hover transition (150ms ease), sort icon animation (150ms ease-out), cell focus ring styles, badge pill styles

Read css/styles.css — verified modal open animation: overlay opacity 0→1 (200ms ease) + modal translateY(8px)→0 (200ms ease), modal close reverses via CSS transition, modal__close button hover transition (color+bg 150ms)
Read js/tasks.js — audited showToast() for entrance/exit animation handling, openModal/closeModal for focus management, filter event handlers for immediate-response feel
Tested page load via Playwright — grid renders with all data, loading pulse animation visible during fetch, transition to grid is clean
Tested row hover via Playwright — background color transition (120ms ease) visible at rgba(0,0,0,0.02), smooth onset and release
Tested New Task button hover — background darkens to --color-accent-active with 150ms transition, smooth
Tested modal open — overlay fades in, modal slides up from translateY(8px), title input receives focus after 50ms setTimeout, animation timing feels correct
Tested modal close — CSS transition reverses the open animation (overlay fades out, modal slides down), focus returns to New Task button
Tested modal validation — red border on invalid fields, error messages appear inline, no animation on error state (acceptable — instant feedback is appropriate for validation)
Tested filter interaction — selecting a value applies accent border with 150ms transition, badge and clear button appear instantly (no fade), grid re-filters instantly via AG Grid external filter API
Tested search input focus — width expands 180px→240px with 200ms ease transition, accent border + box-shadow ring appear, smooth and well-timed
Tested clear button — filters reset instantly, badge/clear button disappear instantly (no exit transition)
Tested column header sort — sort icon slides in with 150ms ease-out animation, accent color, feels crisp
Verified prefers-reduced-motion section in tasks.css: search transition, toast animation, loading pulse all disabled — modal transitions in styles.css NOT covered (shared concern)
Identified toast exit animation gap: showToast() uses .remove() after 3s setTimeout with no fade-out — entrance has slide+fade animation but exit is instant DOM removal
decisions: PASS — 0 P1 issues, 5 P2 notes. Nothing blocks ship.
P2-1: Toast dismissal has no exit animation — design spec says 'fade out after 3s' but implementation uses instant .remove(). Should add opacity transition before removal.
P2-2: Filter badge and clear button appear/disappear instantly via hidden attribute toggle — would feel more polished with a quick 150ms opacity fade.
P2-3: Modal transitions (overlay fade, modal slide) not covered by prefers-reduced-motion — this is a shared concern across all pages using the modal pattern in styles.css, not tasks-specific.
P2-4: No cursor:pointer on AG Grid rows to indicate click-to-navigate behavior — Project column has its own cursor:pointer via .tasks__project-link, but ID and Title cells don't signal clickability.
P2-5: New Task button :hover and :active states are identical (both --color-accent-active) — matches spec exactly, but a subtle translateY(1px) or scale(0.98) on :active would add press feedback.
